dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4138 IH: Restoring Biological Truth in Government Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Mace (for herself and Mr. Moore of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit the heads of executive agencies from asking about gender identity on any form or survey, to require executive agencies provide male and female as the only options to respond to questions about sex or gender on any forms or surveys and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring Biological Truth in Government Act.

section.header: Prohibition on asking about gender identity on any executive agency form or survey

subsection.text: With respect to any collection of information conducted by or for an executive agency through a form or survey, the head of such agency—

subparagraph.text: solicit or obtain any information regarding the gender identity of an individual; and
provide an option to select or mark on the form or survey that sex or gender of an individual is something other than male or female; and

paragraph.text: shall reject the submission of any such form or survey that provides a response other than male or female to a required question on sex or gender.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall issue guidance to the heads of covered agencies on the implementation of the provisions of this section.

paragraph.text: The term executive agency means an establishment in the executive branch of the Federal Government, including—

subparagraph.text: the Executive Office of the President;

paragraph.text: The term female means an individual who naturally has, had, will have, or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident, the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes eggs for fertilization.

clause.text: males, females, or the natural differences between males and females, unless such term is otherwise specified or used alone (rather than with or as an adjective modifying other words); and

subparagraph.text: does not mean gender identity, experienced gender, gender expression, or gender roles.

paragraph.text: The term gender identity does not mean sex or gender.

The term male means an individual who naturally has, had, will have, or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident, the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes sperm for fertilization.
The term sex means the biological determination as to whether an individual is male or female.
